data.title: Tommy Davidson Jr (1936-2010)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Tommy Davidson Jr born 1936 Tennessee, United States died 2010 Oneida, Scott, Tennessee, USA including ancestors + descendants + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[spouse(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 24 Dec 2021 | Created 20 Dec 2020

This page has been accessed 240 times.

Biography

Tommy Davidson Jr was born on 20 Jun 1936 in Tennessee, United States. His parents were Thomas Oscar Davidson (1907 - 1984) and Elizabeth (Thomas) Davidson (1903 - 1988).

His siblings were...

Wade Davidson (1933 - >1940)

Jolly Edward Davidson (1934 - 1983)

Betty Lou (Davidson) Greene (1938 - 1990)

In 1940, Tommy was living in 4th Dist, Scott, Tennessee, USA.

Tommy's son was Tommy Dwayne Phillips (1960 - living).

Tommy died on 29 Nov 2010 in Oneida, Scott, Tennessee, USA aged 74. He is buried in Cotton Cemetery, Oneida, Scott, Tennessee, United States of America.

DAVIDSON, TOMMY died 29 Nov 2010 Tommy Davidson, 74, of Oneida, passed away November 29, 2010, at his home. Funeral arrangements were incomplete as of press time Tuesday. A complete obituary will be printed in next week's edition of the Independent Herald. West-Murley Funeral Home had charge of arrangements. (Source: The Independent Herald, 2 Dec 2010, pA5)

DAVIDSON, TOMMY died 29 Nov 2010 Tommy Davidson, Jr., 74, of the High Point community, passed away November 29, 2010, at his home surrounded by his family. Born June 20, 1936, he was preceded in death by his parents, Tommy Sr. and Elizabeth (Lizzy) Thomas Davidson; great-grandchildren, Tyler and Savannah Laxton; brothers: John Henry, James Buster, and Dewitt West, and Jolly Edward and Joseph Wade Davidson; and sisters: Pearlie Boles and Betty Lou Greene. He was a born-again Christian. He is survived by his wife, Sally Davidson of the High Point community; daughters: Patsy Sue Phillips and husband, Steve, and Elizabeth Ann Reed and husband, John; son, Michael Davidson; eight grandchildren, 15 great-grandchildren, three great-great-grandchildren, sister, Imogene Stanley and husband, Clyde; several nieces and nephews, and many other relatives. Funeral service was conducted December 2, in the chapel of West-Murley Funeral Home with Bro. Ken Davidson and Bro. Tommy Craig officiating. Interment was conducted December 3, at Cotton Cemetery. West-Murley Funeral Home had charge of arrangements. (Source: The Independent Herald, 9 Dec 2010, pA5)

The following appeared in the 6 Jan 2011 edition of the Independent Herald on page A5: CARD OF THANKS - We, the family of Tommy Davidson, Jr., would like to extend our sincere thanks to all our friends, neighbors, and family for their support, love, and all the prayers during the illness and loss of our loved one. We would like to send out a special thank you to everyone who brought food, sent flowers, or gave money. Thank you to the ladies who prepared a meal the day of the service. We would also like to thank all the staff of West-Murley Funeral Home for all their kindness and for the wonderful job they did. A special thank you to all the singers, the grandchildren for singing their papaws favorite song, and to Bro. Ken Davidson and Bro. Tommy Craig for a wonderful service. We would like to apologize and say thank you to those who served as pallbearers for not putting your names in the obituary: Grandsons: Jeremy Chitwood, Tommy Craig, David Davidson, Justin Hicks, Nicholas Anders; and sons-in-law: John Reed, Steve Phillips, and Jared Ginn. Thank you all and may God bless each of you. Sincerely, Sally Davidson, Patsy Phillips & Family, Liz Reed & Family, Mike Davidson & Family

Tommy Davidson Jr. age 74 of the Highpoint Community in Oneida, Tennessee went home to be with the Lord on Monday, November 29, 2010 at his home surrounded by his family. Born June 20, 1936 he was the son of the late Tommy Sr. and Elizabeth (Lizzy) Thomas Davidson. Tommy was a born again Christian. Preceded in death by his parents Tommy Sr. and Elizabeth (Lizzy) Thomas Davidson; brothers John Henry West, James Buster West, Dewitt West, Jolly Edward Davidson and Joseph Wade Davidson; sisters Perlie West Boles and Betty Lou Davidson Greene; great-grandchildren Tyler and Savannah Laxton.Survived by his wife Sally Sue Davidson; daughters Patsy Sue Phillips and husband Steve and Elizabeth Ann Reed and husband John; son Michael Davidson; sister Imogene Stanley and husband Clyde; Grandchildren Jeremy Chitwood, Tonya Anders, Christy Ginn and husband Jarred, Tabitha Hicks, Tommy Craig and wife Samatha, David Davidson, Ashley Davidson and Brittany Evans; fifteen great-grandchildren; three Great great grandchildren. Many other nephews, nieces, and other Family and friends.Friends may visit with the Davidson family on Thursday, December 2, 2010 from 6 pm until time of funeral service at 8 pm in the Chapel of West Murley Funeral Home with Bro. Ken Davidson and Bro. Tommy Craig officiating. Interment will be on Friday, December 3, 2010 at 12 noon in the Cotton Cemetery. West Murley Funeral Home is serving the family of Tommy Davidson Jr.

Profile created by [[Phillips-34101 |
